page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Fairthorne Msnor was owned by William de la Hoole and his wife Agnes in l854, when the Manor was built, but it has been reconstructed many times. In l947 it was taken over by the Y.M.C.A. It has been built up and now owns 94 acres. The house had many historical sculptures and crests carved into the walls It also has a hidden room at the side of the house. There are two panels, glass, but they are not part of any known room. There are plans to get into the room. {MEDIA} Jean Harvey is the editor of "Spotlight", a magazine which is distributed in a wide area. It advertises local business and prints local news and travel. 30000 copies are published a month.
